context: "Oli" is the past tense third person singular form of the Estonian verb "olema", which means "to be". It corresponds to English "was" and is used when referring to a single subject in the past. For example, "Kool oli suur" means "The school was big." The verb "olema" has different forms for different persons and tenses - "oli" specifically indicates third person singular (he/she/it) in the simple past tense.
